options/0/title: Discounts you receive by using preemptible VM instances
options/0/rationale: That's incorrect. Discounts on preemptible VM instances are unrelated to sustained use discounts.
options/1/title: Automatic discounts that you get for running specific Compute Engine resources for a significant portion of the billing month
options/1/rationale: That's correct! Sustained use discounts are automatic discounts that you get for running specific Compute Engine resources (vCPUs, memory, GPU devices) for a significant portion of the billing month. To take advantage of the full 30% discount, create your VM instances on the first day of the month, because discounts reset at the beginning of each month.
options/2/title: Purchase commitments for specific resources you know you will use
options/2/rationale: That's incorrect, those would be committed use discounts.
options/3/title: Per-second billing that starts after a 1 minute minimum
options/3/rationale: That's incorrect. This statement is true for any VM instance but has nothing to do with sustained use discounts.

stem: Which statement is true of Virtual Machine Instances in Compute Engine?
options/0/title: In Compute Engine, a VM is a networked service that simulates the features of a computer.
options/0/rationale: VMs in Compute Engine are a collection of networked services which includes persistent disks that are network-attached. In some cases the Google Cloud VM behaves unlike hardware or other kinds of virtual machines, for example, when a multi-tenant virtual CPU "bursts", using excess capacity beyond the VM spec.
options/1/title: A VM in Compute Engine always maps to a single hardware computer in a rack.
options/1/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/2/title: Compute Engine uses VMware to create Virtual Machine Instances.
options/2/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/3/title: All Compute Engine VMs are single tenancy and do not share CPU hardware.
options/3/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.

stem: Which statement is true of persistent disks?
options/0/title: Persistent disks are always HDDs (magnetic spinning disks).
options/0/rationale: I recommend reviewing the lectures in this module.
options/1/title: Persistent disks are encrypted by default.
options/1/rationale: Persistent Disks are not physical disks, they are a virtual-networked service. Each persistent disk remains encrypted either with system-defined keys or with customer-supplied keys.
options/2/title: Persistent disks are physical hardware devices connected directly to VMs.
options/2/rationale: That's incorrect. I recommend going back to the lectures of this module to review this concept.
options/3/title: Once created, a persistent disk cannot be resized.
options/3/rationale: That is not the right answer. Please go back and review the lectures in this module.
